cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, expected to bend WNW then NW toward the Bahamas and south Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Florida / Florida Keys area (near PortMiami)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, Cuba, and eventually south Florida coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (57% chance) with a 31% chance of sustained 50-kt winds and a 16% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at PortMiami within 5 days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge exceeding 3 ft possible along the southeast Florida coast and Biscayne Bay as Irma approaches/landfalls.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands associated with Irma could exceed 4–8 inches, causing flash-flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large breaking waves, dangerous surf and rip currents; possible port closure and vessel restrictions ahead of gale onset.
